result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stacey A Tornberg

defendant.name: Tornberg, Stacey A
defendant.address: 811 E Harrison Street Apt 102, Marshfield, WI 54449

records.addlTxt:
Temporarily Away, Unable to Forward
Notice of Hearing

9:11 AM Defendant Stacey A Tornberg in court.  Attorney Aaron Thomas Vruwink in court for Stacey A Tornberg.  Attorney Rose Yanke in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Dismissed and read-in to 22CF167.
Final pre-trial on September 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:50 AM Defendant Stacey A Tornberg in court.  Attorney Travis S Slattery in court for Stacey A Tornberg.  Attorney Daniel McGrath in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant requests Attorney Slattery withdraws from the case. Attorney Slattery will file the withdrawal order.
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:08 AM Defendant Stacey A Tornberg in court.  Attorney Travis S Slattery in court for Stacey A Tornberg.  Attorney Daniel McGrath in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Officer Erickson is sworn in and testifies. Testifies to being an Officer for the Marshfield Police Department. Testifies to being dispatched to a noise complaint. Testifies to making contact w/ two females and one of them being the defendant. Witness identifies the defendant in court, court recognizes. Testifies to seeing a pipe on the porch and what it is used for commonly. Testifies to the defendant stating she had smoked marijuana. Testifies to testing the pipe and the results of what was in it.
Attorney Slattery cross examines the witness. 
Attorney McGrath requests the court take Judicial Notice of a case that a bond was in effect during this allegation.

Court finds probable cause to believe a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. 

Bond is continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Court appoints Travis Slattery as counsel - No reimbursement required.
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on June 27, 2022 at 09:15 am.

10:34 AM Defendant Stacey A Tornberg not in court.  Attorney Daniel McGrath in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court goes over the case and finds good cause to go over time limits. 
This matter was supposed to be reset and wasn't. Courts will try to get ahold of Attorney Slattery.
Defendant must pay the $100 cash bond by Friday 05.20.2022. Absolute sobriety. No controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of drug paraphernalia. $100
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on May 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant must pay the $100 cash bond by Friday 05/20/2022.
Absolute sobriety. No controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of drug paraphernalia.

2:16 PM Defendant Stacey A Tornberg appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Daniel McGrath in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court finds probable cause to continue this matter. This matter will be bound over for preliminary hearing and arraignment.
